name: Spearmint
tagline: An updated id Tech 3 engine for continuing the classics and creating new games.
body:
**Spearmint** is a [ioquake3](http://ioquake3.org) based game engine that has two main goals;

  1. provide a flexible engine for creating new games and mods.
  2. support features from (and running) various id Tech 3-based games.

Some of the major features are:

  * Four player splitscreen
  * Moved a lot of code from server and client to Game and CGame VMs;
    * including [console](https://github.com/zturtleman/spearmint/blob/master/code/cgame/cg_console.c), chat input overlay, [usercmd_t creation](https://github.com/zturtleman/spearmint/blob/master/code/cgame/cg_input.c), and a lot of [bot AI code](https://github.com/zturtleman/spearmint/tree/master/code/game).
  * Allow games to modify `entityState_t` and `playerState_t` without changing the engine.
  * Extended API for [Game](http://github.com/zturtleman/spearmint/wiki/Game%20API) and [CGame/UI](http://github.com/zturtleman/spearmint/wiki/CGame%20API), includes some of the features from;
    * RTCW, WolfET, Tremulous, Turtle Arena, and World of Padman
  * Merged UI VM into CGame VM, easier to modify as a whole / more flexible.
  * Additional [shader](http://github.com/zturtleman/spearmint/wiki/Shaders) keywords.

Read more at the [Spearmint wiki](http://github.com/zturtleman/spearmint/wiki).

## Running Quake III Arena using Spearmint
* Get the source and compile it using make. The game will be in `build/release-YOURPLATFORM-YOURARCH/`.
* Copy your Quake III Arena `pak[0-8].pk3` into `build/release-YOURPLATFORM-YOURARCH/baseq3`. (Don't own Q3? Buy it on [Steam](http://store.steampowered.com/sub/433/).)
* Get the Spearmint Q3A patch files from [here](https://github.com/zturtleman/spearmint-patch-data) and put in `build/release-YOURPLATFORM-YOURARCH/baseq3/`
* Run `build/release-YOURPLATFORM-YOURARCH/spearmint_YOURARCH`

You can add splitscreen players after you start or join a server using the in-game menu.

## Running Quake III: Team Arena using Spearmint
* Follow the steps for Quake III Arena above.
* Copy your Quake III: Team Arena `pak[0-3].pk3` into `build/release-YOURPLATFORM-YOURARCH/missionpack`. (Don't own Team Arena? Buy it on [Steam](http://store.steampowered.com/sub/433/).)
* Get the Spearmint Q3TA patch files from [here](https://github.com/zturtleman/spearmint-patch-data) and put in `build/release-YOURPLATFORM-YOURARCH/missionpack/`
* Run `build/release-YOURPLATFORM-YOURARCH/spearmint_YOURARCH` and choose Team Arena from the menu.

The UI currently lacks support for splitscreen. You can add splitscreen players after you start or join a server using the console (open/close using shift+esc or ~). 2dropin, 3dropin, and 4dropin commands add splitscreen players. 2dropout, 3dropout, and 4dropout commands remove splitscreen players. You'll need to manually bind controls, example `bind u +2forward` to have u move player 2 forward. Type `+2` then press tab to see full list.
